00012 // Set up three state model including stochastic trans matricies for each 
00013 ThreeState::ThreeState() {
00014 
00015     actionDim = ACTION_DIM; // Simple model, 1
00016     obsRows = OBS_DIM;
00017     obsCols = 1;
00018     actions = ACTIONS;
00019     agents = 1;
00020 
00021     stateTrans = new Matrix[ACTIONS];
00022 
00023     // The transition and observation matrices
00024     istringstream data("[3,3]((0.2, 0.8, 0.0),(0.8, 0.0, 0.2),(0.2, 0.8, 0.0)) \
00025                         [3,3]((0.8, 0.2, 0.0),(0.2, 0.0, 0.8),(0.8, 0.2, 0.0)) \
00026                         [2,3]((0.667, 0.333, 0.2777),(6, 12, 5))");
00027     for (int a=0; a < ACTIONS; a++) {
00028         data>>stateTrans[a];
00029         cout<<"Matrix from raw :"<<a<<": "<<stateTrans[a]<<endl;
00030     }
00031     
00032     data>>allObs;
00033     cout<<"Observations: "<<allObs<<endl;
00034 
00035     rewards.resize(STATES);
00036     rewards(0) = 1;
00037     rewards(1) = -1;
00038     rewards(2) = 8;
00039 
00040     currState = random()%STATES;
00041 
00042 }
00043 
00044 
00045 // Return reward direct from reward vector 
00046 // INPUT: vector to put the
00047 // local rewards in. In this case, there's no local rewards so we put
00048 // the same thing in the first element of the vector that we would
00049 // otherwise return for the global reward.
00050 void ThreeState::getReward(Vector& rewards) {
00051 
00052     assert(rewards.size() == 1);
00053     rewards[0] = this->rewards[currState];
00054 
00055 }
00056 
00057 
00058 // INPUT: matrix structre, 1x1, to return int observation in
00059 void ThreeState::getObservation(Observation& obs) {
00060 
00061     column(obs.getFeatures(), 0) = column(allObs, currState);
00062 //    obs.getFeatures()(0,0) = currState;
00063 
00064 }
00065 
00066 
00067 // Do the action, core of the simulator
00068 // INPUT: action vector which will always be 1x1 in this case.
00069 int ThreeState::doAction(Vector& action) {
00070 
00071     Vector stateTransRow(STATES);
00072     int a = (int)action[0];
00073 
00074     assert(a < ACTIONS);
00075 
00076     // Extract the correct row of the state transition matrix
00077     stateTransRow = row(stateTrans[a], currState);
00078 
00079     // Update the state randomly. We know the CDF is 1.0
00080     currState = Sampler::discrete(stateTransRow, 1.0);
00081 
00082     return 0;
00083 }
00084

00086 // Maximum episode length in steps. For planning mode. Only used
00087 // by GOALPomdp at the moment.
00088 int ThreeState::getMaxEpisodeLength() {
00089     return 0;
00090 }

00092 // Get the number of rows in observation matrix. Generally the
00093 // length of the observation vector.
00094 int ThreeState::getObsRows() {
00095     return obsRows;
00096 }
00097 
00098 // Get the number of columns in the observation matrix Typically
00099 // use multiple columns to provide a different observation to each
00100 // agent, so the number of columns is the same as getAgents()
00101 int ThreeState::getObsCols() {
00102     return obsCols;
00103 }
00104 
00105 // Get the total number of agents. Usually 1.
00106 int ThreeState::getAgents() {
00107     return agents;
00108 }
00109 
00110 // Get the total action dimensionality. Often, but not
00111 // necessarily, the same as the number of agents.
00112 int ThreeState::getActionDim() {
00113     return actionDim;
00114 }

00119 int ThreeState::getNumActions() {
00120     return ACTIONS;
